trans-unit.source: How to deploy a SQL Database to SQL Azure
trans-unit.target: How to deploy a SQL Database to SQL Azure

trans-unit.source: Deploy a SQL Server database to Azure SQL Database using the Wizard in SQL Server 2016 Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: Deploy a SQL Server database to Azure SQL Database using the Wizard in SQL Server 2016 Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: How to Deploy a SQL Server database to Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: How to Deploy a SQL Server database to Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: In this article, you'll use the **Deploy Database to Azure SQL Database wizard** to upload a sample database to Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you'll use the **Deploy Database to Azure SQL Database wizard** to upload a sample database to Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: You must download **SQL Server 2016 Management Studio (CTP 2.1)** for this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You must download **SQL Server 2016 Management Studio (CTP 2.1)** for this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Estimated time to completion: 15 minutes (includes download time)
trans-unit.target: Estimated time to completion: 15 minutes (includes download time)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorial uses a "school" sample database that is purposefully simple; all of its objects are compatible with Azure SQL Database, eliminating the need to modify or prepare the database for migration.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorial uses a "school" sample database that is purposefully simple; all of its objects are compatible with Azure SQL Database, eliminating the need to modify or prepare the database for migration.

trans-unit.source: If you are migrating a more complex existing database, you could also consider using the [SQL Database Migration Wizard](http://sqlazuremw.codeplex.com/) and see this [overview](sql-database-cloud-migrate.md).
trans-unit.target: If you are migrating a more complex existing database, you could also consider using the [SQL Database Migration Wizard](http://sqlazuremw.codeplex.com/) and see this [overview](sql-database-cloud-migrate.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: A **Microsoft Azure account**.
trans-unit.target: A **Microsoft Azure account**.

trans-unit.source: For a free trial, see this [offer](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: For a free trial, see this [offer](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: Download [**SQL Server Management Studio**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt238290.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Download [**SQL Server Management Studio**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt238290.aspx).

trans-unit.source: (For more information about the tool, see [SQL Server Management Studio - June 2015 Release Notes](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt238486.aspx).)
trans-unit.target: (For more information about the tool, see [SQL Server Management Studio - June 2015 Release Notes](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt238486.aspx).)

trans-unit.source: An existing **Azure SQL Database server**.
trans-unit.target: An existing **Azure SQL Database server**.

trans-unit.source: In order to create a server, you must create at least one database first.
trans-unit.target: In order to create a server, you must create at least one database first.

trans-unit.source: When you create a database, you have the choice of creating it on a new server, or on an existing server.
trans-unit.target: When you create a database, you have the choice of creating it on a new server, or on an existing server.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on creating a new database (on a new server), see [Create your first Azure SQL Database](sql-database-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on creating a new database (on a new server), see [Create your first Azure SQL Database](sql-database-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: Create the school database on an on-premises server
trans-unit.target: Create the school database on an on-premises server

trans-unit.source: Run these scripts in SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) to create an on-premises version of the "school" database.
trans-unit.target: Run these scripts in SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) to create an on-premises version of the "school" database.

trans-unit.source: In SSMS, connect to an on-premises server.
trans-unit.target: In SSMS, connect to an on-premises server.

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Databases**, click **New Database**, and enter *school*.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Databases**, click **New Database**, and enter *school*.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on *school*, click **New Query**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on *school*, click **New Query**.

trans-unit.source: Copy and execute this script:
trans-unit.target: Copy and execute this script:

trans-unit.source: Next, copy and execute the Insert Data script.
trans-unit.target: Next, copy and execute the Insert Data script.

trans-unit.source: You now have an on-premises database that you can export to Azure.
trans-unit.target: You now have an on-premises database that you can export to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Next, you'll run a wizard that creates a .bacpac file, loads it onto Azure, and imports it into SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Next, you'll run a wizard that creates a .bacpac file, loads it onto Azure, and imports it into SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Deploy the database to Azure SQL
trans-unit.target: Deploy the database to Azure SQL

trans-unit.source: In Management Studio, right-click the school database that you just created, point to **Tasks**, and click **Deploy Database to Microsoft Azure SQL Database**.
trans-unit.target: In Management Studio, right-click the school database that you just created, point to **Tasks**, and click **Deploy Database to Microsoft Azure SQL Database**.

trans-unit.source: In **Deployment Settings**, enter a name for the database, such as *school*.
trans-unit.target: In **Deployment Settings**, enter a name for the database, such as *school*.

trans-unit.source: Click **Connect**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Connect**.

trans-unit.source: To solve problems with connectivity, try this [troubleshooter](https://support2.microsoft.com/common/survey.aspx?scid=sw;en;3844&showpage=1).
trans-unit.target: To solve problems with connectivity, try this [troubleshooter](https://support2.microsoft.com/common/survey.aspx?scid=sw;en;3844&showpage=1).

trans-unit.source: In **Server name**, enter the 10-character server name, followed by **.database.windows.net**
trans-unit.target: In **Server name**, enter the 10-character server name, followed by **.database.windows.net**

trans-unit.source: In **Authentication**, choose **SQL Server Authentication**.
trans-unit.target: In **Authentication**, choose **SQL Server Authentication**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the administrator login name and password that you created when provisioning the SQL Database logical server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the administrator login name and password that you created when provisioning the SQL Database logical server.

trans-unit.source: Click **Options**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Options**.

trans-unit.source: In Connection Properties, in **Connect to database**, type **master**.
trans-unit.target: In Connection Properties, in **Connect to database**, type **master**.

trans-unit.source: **Note** You must connect to the **master** database whenever you want to create a database on the Azure SQL Database server.
trans-unit.target: **Note** You must connect to the **master** database whenever you want to create a database on the Azure SQL Database server.

trans-unit.source: Click **Connect**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Connect**.

trans-unit.source: This step concludes the connection specification and takes you back to the wizard.
trans-unit.target: This step concludes the connection specification and takes you back to the wizard.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next** and click **Finish** to run the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next** and click **Finish** to run the wizard.

trans-unit.source: How to: Verify database deployment
trans-unit.target: How to: Verify database deployment

trans-unit.source: In Management Studio, under **Object Explorer**, click the **Connect** icon.
trans-unit.target: In Management Studio, under **Object Explorer**, click the **Connect** icon.

trans-unit.source: In the **Server** name box, type the name of the Azure SQL server, followed by **database.windows.net**
trans-unit.target: In the **Server** name box, type the name of the Azure SQL server, followed by **database.windows.net**

trans-unit.source: In **Authentication**, select **SQL Server Authenication**.
trans-unit.target: In **Authentication**, select **SQL Server Authenication**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the administrator login name and password you created when provisioning the server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the administrator login name and password you created when provisioning the server.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Options** button.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Options** button.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Connect to database** dropdown, and click **Browse server**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Connect to database** dropdown, and click **Browse server**.

trans-unit.source: In the following dialog box, click **Yes** to allow browsing of the server.
trans-unit.target: In the following dialog box, click **Yes** to allow browsing of the server.

trans-unit.source: Click the **school** database to select it, then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **school** database to select it, then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Connect**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Connect**.

trans-unit.source: To solve problems with connectivity, try this [troubleshooter](https://support2.microsoft.com/common/survey.aspx?scid=sw;en;3844&showpage=1).
trans-unit.target: To solve problems with connectivity, try this [troubleshooter](https://support2.microsoft.com/common/survey.aspx?scid=sw;en;3844&showpage=1).

trans-unit.source: Expand the **Databases** folder.
trans-unit.target: Expand the **Databases** folder.

trans-unit.source: You should see the **school** database in the list.
trans-unit.target: You should see the **school** database in the list.

trans-unit.source: **Note** You must connect to the database you want to query.
trans-unit.target: **Note** You must connect to the database you want to query.

trans-unit.source: Right-click **school** and click **New Query**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **school** and click **New Query**.

trans-unit.source: Execute the following query to verify that data is accessible.
trans-unit.target: Execute the following query to verify that data is accessible.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: For a tutorial on creating a new Azure SQL database, see [Getting Started with SQL Database Administration](sql-database-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: For a tutorial on creating a new Azure SQL database, see [Getting Started with SQL Database Administration](sql-database-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: For the basics of connecting to an Azure SQL database from a C# app, see [Connect to and query your SQL Database with C#](sql-database-connect-query.md).
trans-unit.target: For the basics of connecting to an Azure SQL database from a C# app, see [Connect to and query your SQL Database with C#](sql-database-connect-query.md).

trans-unit.source: For more tutorials on connection from various platforms (such as PHP) see [Azure SQL Database Development: How-to Topics](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee621787.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more tutorials on connection from various platforms (such as PHP) see [Azure SQL Database Development: How-to Topics](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee621787.aspx).
